Maximize Your Botox

Maximize Your Botox

3 Ways to Make Your Botox Last Longer


As you relish your rejuvenated look the receptionist chimes, ‚ÄúLet's schedule your next appointment. What works for you?‚Äù

You think, ‚ÄúGood question. How long will this Botox treatment last? When should I schedule my next appointment? Can I stretch the time between visits? Oh I have so many questions. Good thing I just had Botox, she can't see my wrinkled brow. üòÜ‚Äù

We've been there, we know it's money invested in you, and we get it! So we're here to help.


How long does Botox last?
On average 3-4 months


Can I stretch the time between visits?
Of course! Follow these top-tips below to stretch your look, and your money, further to the next session.


1. Follow Your Post-Treatment Instructions
Avoid rubbing or massaging the treated area for at least 24 hours. Don't lie down or exercise for 4 hours after your appointment. This helps prevent Botox from migrating to unintended areas.

2. Maintain a Consistent Treatment Schedule
Sticking to a regular Botox schedule (every 3-4 months) can help ‚Äútrain‚Äù the muscles to relax more consistently. Over time, you may even need fewer units. Yay!

3. Use Medical-Grade Skincare
Support your Botox results with products that boost collagen, hydration, and cellular repair. Check out the curated selection of skincare products we use at Simply You, Nurse Aesthetics, to help you get the most out of your treatment.

Bonus Tip: Stay out of the sun (wear sunscreen when you do), avoid smoking, drink water, and maintain a healthy lifestyle. These habits protect your skin and enhance your results.


Botox is an investment in your self-confidence, and we know you want it to last as long as possible. When you're ready to schedule your next appointment, book it here. We can't wait to make you feel and look your best.
